title: TheoremExplainAgent: Towards Multimodal Explanations for LLM Theorem Understanding
author: Max Ku (University of Waterloo), Thomas Chong (Votee AI), Jonathan Leung (University of Waterloo), Krish Shah (University of Waterloo), Alvin Yu (Votee AI), Wenhu Chen (University of Waterloo)
relevance_why: The integration of multimedia explanations could be applied to my audio generation work by providing visual context and structure that enhances understanding and engagement in audio-visual generation tasks.
background: This study introduces an agentic model that generates educational theorem-explanation videos, combining visual and auditory components to enhance understanding of complex concepts.
contribution: TheoremExplainAgent introduces a multimodal video generation framework to solve the challenge of explaining mathematical theorems effectively, achieving significant improvements in clarity and visualization over traditional methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous approaches generally focused on purely text-based explanations, which lacked the multimodal interaction necessary for deeper comprehension.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances traditional theorem explanation by integrating dynamic visualizations and structured audio narration, providing a more engaging learning experience.

key_innovation: Utilizes an agent-based planning and coding architecture to automate the generation of long-form educational videos that effectively combine visual and auditory information.
real_world_impact: This framework could drastically improve educational methods in STEM fields, allowing for more intuitive understanding of complex theories through rich multimedia presentations.
limitations: Issues with visual element layout and minor inaccuracies in animations have been noted as areas requiring further improvement.

new_terms.theorem explainability: **Theorem explainability** refers to the ability to clearly and effectively communicate the reasoning behind mathematical theorems through various means, particularly in a visual format.
new_terms.agentic model: **Agentic model** denotes a system that can autonomously reason and execute tasks based on defined goals and environmental interactions, as seen in complex automation processes.

open_sourcing: TheoremExplainBench dataset will be released on Huggingface with MIT license.
